page.title: 14Local History 3
page.content: {Interview:Mr.and Mrs.Smith (cont'd). { Changes (cont'd) } The{railway}had now disappeared,too, and so had the Railway Tavern leaving one public house in Willoughby called the Willoughby Arms.The main line of the railway was built in 1848 and went to Alford and Louth to the north and Boston to the south.A branch line was added in 1886 which superseded a tram- line from Alford to Sutton-on-Sea and Mablethorpe. The station bridge was removed but can still be seen near Burgh-le-Marsh. There was a blacksmith's forge where Whites now have their lawnmower shop; near White's garage there was a cobbler named Mr.R.Dalton who also made willow baskets;the corner stores has been many things including a fish and chip shop.The Smith's house was a store and was next to a butcher.
